summary: This document is a FOIA tracking log from the Executive Office for United States Attorneys (EOUSA), dated March 10, 2021, summarizing multiple Freedom of Information Act requests related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It details requests from journalists, media organizations, lawyers, and other entities seeking records from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and other offices, including banking records, case files, mugshots, and communications. The log shows the status and handling of these requests, including references to ongoing litigation and exemptions claimed. This document is a compilation of FOIA request logs and action notes from the Executive Office for United States Attorneys (EOUSA) related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It details multiple requests from media, researchers, and studios for records on investigations, prosecutions, agreements, surveillance, incarceration, death, and related legal cases.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the criminal case; subject of numerous FOIA requests for records related to his assets, investigations, and death in custody.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested on sex trafficking charges; subject of FOIA requests for her mugshot and case files, referenced as an alleged accomplice of Epstein.

persons.name: Greg Farrell
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request seeking the name of a financial institution ('Institution-1') referenced in SDNY court filings regarding Epstein's assets.

persons.name: William Marshall
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request for all records regarding Jeffrey Epstein maintained by the US Attorney's Offices for SDNY and SDFL.

persons.name: Sarah/John Thomas Volscho
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request for five years of Jeffrey Epstein's banking records from 'Institution-1' referenced by SDNY.

persons.name: Colin Kalmbacher
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request for Ghislaine Maxwell's mugshot and photographs, arguing for release based on precedent and public interest.

persons.name: Michael Greene
persons.context: Submitted a broad FOIA request covering multiple topics, including communications related to the Epstein investigation, Palm Beach police, and a federal magistrate.

persons.name: Sigrid S McCawley
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request on behalf of a client for all SDNY records relating to Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and others.

persons.name: Merris Badcock
persons.context: Submitted a comprehensive FOIA request for all records related to Jeffrey Epstein, including allegations of solicitation and running a sex ring in Palm Beach County.

persons.name: Jahi A Hasanati
persons.context: Submitted FOIA requests for the docket sheet and indictment in the SDNY case against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Douglas Montero
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request for all files, photographs, videos, and audio records pertaining to the July 6, 2019 SDNY indictment of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Thomas McCawley
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request for records concerning a client and Jeffrey Epstein from multiple districts, noting Epstein's death and priority for client records.

persons.name: Olivia G Davies
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request for communications between Buckingham Palace/Prince Andrew and the Justice Department regarding lobbying for Epstein.

persons.name: Sai LNU
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request for all SDNY records about Jeffrey Epstein, acknowledging potential exemptions but challenging privacy claims due to Epstein's death.

persons.name: Richard Berman
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient of a July 12, 2019 letter from SDNY referencing 'Institution-1' in relation to Epstein's assets.

persons.name: James Comey
persons.context: Mentioned in a FOIA request regarding a memo about an investigation into the Clinton Foundation as it related to Marc Rich.

persons.name: Ann Marie Villafana
persons.context: Mentioned in a FOIA request regarding communications about the handling of the 'Jane Doe One and 2 v United States' case.

persons.name: David Lee Brannnon
persons.context: Mentioned in a FOIA request questioning his impartiality for defending Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's butler.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Mentioned as Epstein's butler who was defended by Magistrate David Lee Brannnon and received more prison time than Epstein.

persons.name: Barry Krischer
persons.context: Mentioned in a FOIA request for all communication in or out of his office related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Lanna Belohlavek
persons.context: Mentioned in a FOIA request for communications from Barry Krischer's office.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Mentioned in a FOIA request for communications from Barry Krischer's office related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in a FOIA request for communications between his office/Buckingham Palace and the Justice Department lobbying on behalf of Epstein.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Mentioned as having requested communications involving Prince Andrew in the 'Jane Doe 1 and 2 v USA' case.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Mentioned as the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York in a FOIA request covering records about Epstein.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in FOIA requests for records relating to him, alongside Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Central subject of all FOIA requests; requests seek records on his investigations, prosecution, incarceration, death, and agreements with U.S. Attorneys' offices.

persons.name: Ed Frost
persons.role: Requester (South Mountain Research LLC / Environmental Solutions)
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request for all written and oral agreements between Jeffrey Epstein and U.S. Attorneys' offices in SDFL and SDNY from 1992 to his death.

persons.name: Kevina Tidwell
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request for audio, video, photographic records, and transcripts related to Epstein and Maxwell cases, including 911 calls, victim interviews, and surveillance.

persons.name: Johannes Perterer
persons.context: Submitted a FOIA request for information on Jeffrey Epstein's Austrian passport, including issuance details and travel history.

connections.description: Referred to as alleged accomplices in sex trafficking charges; both are subjects of numerous FOIA requests for case files and investigations.
Rodriguez is identified as Epstein's butler, who was defended by Magistrate David Lee Brannnon.
FOIA request seeks communications showing Prince Andrew lobbied the Justice Department on Epstein's behalf.
Both are attorneys at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP submitting FOIA requests on behalf of clients related to Epstein and Maxwell.
Mark Epstein is listed alongside Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in FOIA requests for records, indicating an association.
Both are mentioned in a FOIA request for communications from Krischer's office related to the Epstein investigation.
Linked together in multiple FOIA requests for records related to their joint investigations, prosecutions, and alleged crimes.
FOIA requests seek all written and oral agreements between Epstein and the U.S. Attorneys' offices in Southern District of Florida and Southern District of New York.

events.title: SDNY Court Filing on Epstein Assets
events.description: SDNY filed Document 11 in case 19-cr-00490, referencing an unnamed financial institution ('Institution-1') concerning assets controlled by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died while in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in Bradford, New Hampshire, on sex trafficking charges and held at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.

events.title: Initial Allegations in Palm Beach
events.description: A young girl told Palm Beach Police in 2005 that Jeffrey Epstein was running a sex ring out of his island mansion, triggering investigations.

events.title: SDNY Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The Southern District of New York indicted Jeffrey Epstein on federal charges.

events.title: USA v. Epstein indictment in SDNY
events.description: Criminal case USA v. Epstein, No. 1:19-cr-490, is listed among the cases for which records are requested.

events.title: Brown v. Maxwell appellate decision
events.description: Appellate case Brown v. Maxwell is listed among the civil cases for which records are requested.

events.title: FOIA request for Epstein-US Attorney agreements logged
events.description: FOIA request by Ed Frost for all agreements between Epstein and U.S. Attorneys' offices is logged by EOUSA.

events.title: FOIA request for Maxwell case records logged
events.description: FOIA request by Kevina Tidwell for audio/video records related to Ghislaine Maxwell cases is logged by EOUSA.

locations: 9 E. 71st Street, New York, NY 10021-4102 (Epstein's address)
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th St, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: Multiple FOIA requests seek the identity of 'Institution-1,' a bank referenced in SDNY court filings concerning Jeffrey Epstein's assets.

The EOUSA log indicates that records related to Epstein at SDNY are being withheld under FOIA exemption (b)(7)(A), which protects law enforcement records that could interfere with ongoing proceedings.

A request from the BBC specifically seeks communications between Buckingham Palace/Prince Andrew and the U.S. Justice Department regarding lobbying efforts for Epstein, referencing the 'Jane Doe 1 and 2 v USA' case.
Attorneys from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP are actively filing FOIA requests on behalf of a client, seeking expedited processing for records related to complaints against Epstein in New York.
The log references ongoing FOIA litigation against the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) for Epstein-related documents and notes that the FBI's Epstein records are available in its online FOIA vault.

Multiple FOIA requests seek all records on Jeffrey Epstein, including surveillance, investigation, prosecution, transportation, incarceration, medical treatment, death, autopsy, and agreements with U.S. Attorneys' offices.
Requests specifically target records related to Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal and civil cases, including victim/witness interviews and surveillance materials.
One request seeks information on Jeffrey Epstein's Austrian passport, including issuance details and travel history.
The document indicates active litigation and exemptions (like Exemption 7) are being applied to withhold some Epstein-related records from FOIA release.
The action logs show FOIA requests being processed by the EOUSA, with notes about media status, privacy interests, and coordination with ongoing investigations.
